intro: Crotalaria oligosperma, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cowpea, is a herbaceous annual plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and compound leaves with three to five leaflets. Its flowers are yellow with a distinctive black or purple pattern, and it produces small, pod-like fruits containing several seeds. Crotalaria oligosperma is often found in disturbed soils and can be a weed in agricultural settings.
